meanings.definition: A group of antibiotics derived from Streptomyces caespitosus, used in cancer treatment.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed mitomycins to help fight the cancer cells.
meanings.sent2: The hospital stored mitomycins in a special refrigerator to maintain their effectiveness.
meanings.sent3: The nurse accidentally spilled the mitomycins, causing a colorful mess in the treatment room.
meanings.sent4: The mitomycins acted like tiny soldiers attacking the cancer, one cell at a time.
meanings.sent5: The patient's body welcomed the mitomycins like brave warriors ready for battle.

meanings.definition: Mitomycin C, a specific type of mitomycin used as an antitumor agent.
meanings.sent1: The oncologist recommended mitomycins for their powerful antitumor properties.
meanings.sent2: The pharmacy stocked up on mitomycins due to the high demand from cancer patients.
meanings.sent3: The researcher accidentally spilled the mitomycins, creating a mini explosion in the lab.
meanings.sent4: The mitomycins worked like a skilled sniper targeting the tumor cells with precision.
meanings.sent5: The doctor injected the mitomycins into the IV, unleashing their cancer-fighting magic.
